title.en: Biographies of the disciples of Zhongni
title.raw: 《仲尼弟子列傳》 Biographies of the disciples of Zhongni

sentences.zh: 孔子曰「受業身通者七十有七人」，皆異能之士也。

translations.text: Confucius said: 'Those who received teachings and were personally proficient numbered seventy-seven people,' all men of exceptional abilities.

sentences.zh: 德行：顏淵，閔子騫，冉伯牛，仲弓。

translations.text: Moral conduct: Yan Yuan, Min Ziqian, Ran Boniu, Zhong Gong.
Governance: Ran You, Ji Lu.
Eloquence: Zai Wo, Zi Gong.
Scholarship: Zi You, Zi Xia.

sentences.zh: 師也辟，參也魯，柴也愚，由也喭，回也屢空。

translations.text: Shi is dissolute, Shen is dull, Chai is foolish, You is crude, Hui is often empty.

sentences.zh: 賜不受命而貨殖焉，億則屢中。

translations.text: Ci did not accept office but engaged in commerce, his speculations often hit the mark.

Confucius said: 'Those who received teachings and were personally proficient numbered seventy-seven people,' all men of exceptional abilities. Moral conduct: Yan Yuan, Min Ziqian, Ran Boniu, Zhong Gong. Governance: Ran You, Ji Lu. Eloquence: Zai Wo, Zi Gong. Scholarship: Zi You, Zi Xia. Shi is dissolute, Shen is dull, Chai is foolish, You is crude, Hui is often empty. Ci did not accept office but engaged in commerce, his speculations often hit the mark.

sentences.zh: 孔子之所嚴事：於周則老子；

translations.text: Those whom Confucius treated with respect: in Zhou, Lao Zi;
in Wei, Qu Bo Yu;
in Qi, Yan Ping Zhong;
in Chu, Lao Lai Zi;
in Zheng, Zi Chan;
in Lu, Meng Gong Chuo.

sentences.zh: 數稱臧文仲、柳下惠、銅鞮伯華、介山子然，孔子皆後之，不并世。

translations.text: He frequently praised Zang Wen Zhong, Liu Xia Hui, Tong Di Bo Hua, Jie Shan Zi Ran, Confucius all came after them, not contemporaries.

Those whom Confucius treated with respect: in Zhou, Lao Zi; in Wei, Qu Bo Yu; in Qi, Yan Ping Zhong; in Chu, Lao Lai Zi; in Zheng, Zi Chan; in Lu, Meng Gong Chuo. He frequently praised Zang Wen Zhong, Liu Xia Hui, Tong Di Bo Hua, Jie Shan Zi Ran, Confucius all came after them, not contemporaries.
Yan Hui was a Lu man, styled Zi Yuan.
Younger than Confucius by thirty years.
Yan Hui was a Lu man, styled Zi Yuan. Younger than Confucius by thirty years.

sentences.zh: 顏淵問仁，孔子曰：「克己復禮，天下歸仁焉。」

translations.text: Yan Yuan asked about benevolence, Confucius said: 'Conquer self and return to ritual, all under Heaven will return to benevolence.'
Yan Yuan asked about benevolence, Confucius said: 'Conquer self and return to ritual, all under Heaven will return to benevolence.'
Confucius said: 'Worthy indeed is Hui!

sentences.zh: 一簞食，一瓢飲，在陋巷，人不堪其憂，回也不改其樂。」

translations.text: One basket of food, one gourd of drink, in a humble lane, others cannot bear his worries, Hui does not change his joy.'
'Hui appears foolish;

sentences.zh: 退而省其私，亦足以發，回也不愚。」

translations.text: when he withdraws and examines his private thoughts, it is sufficient to inspire, Hui is not foolish.'

sentences.zh: 「用之則行，捨之則藏，唯我與爾有是夫！」

translations.text: 'When employed then act, when discarded then hide, only I and you have this!'

Confucius said: 'Worthy indeed is Hui! One basket of food, one gourd of drink, in a humble lane, others cannot bear his worries, Hui does not change his joy.' 'Hui appears foolish; when he withdraws and examines his private thoughts, it is sufficient to inspire, Hui is not foolish.' 'When employed then act, when discarded then hide, only I and you have this!'

sentences.zh: 回年二十九，發盡白，蚤死。

translations.text: Hui at age twenty-nine, hair all white, died young.

sentences.zh: 孔子哭之慟，曰：「自吾有回，門人益親。」

translations.text: Confucius wept for him in great sorrow, said: 'Since I had Hui, my disciples have become more intimate.'
Hui at age twenty-nine, hair all white, died young. Confucius wept for him in great sorrow, said: 'Since I had Hui, my disciples have become more intimate.'

sentences.zh: 魯哀公問：「弟子孰為好學？」

translations.text: Duke Ai of Lu asked: 'Which disciple is diligent in study?'

sentences.zh: 孔子對曰：「有顏回者好學，不遷怒，不貳過。

translations.text: Confucius replied: 'There is Yan Hui who is diligent in study, does not transfer anger, does not repeat errors.

sentences.zh: 不幸短命死矣，今也則亡。」

translations.text: Unfortunately died young, now there is none.'

Duke Ai of Lu asked: 'Which disciple is diligent in study?' Confucius replied: 'There is Yan Hui who is diligent in study, does not transfer anger, does not repeat errors. Unfortunately died young, now there is none.'
Min Sun styled Zi Qian.
Younger than Confucius by fifteen years.
Min Sun styled Zi Qian. Younger than Confucius by fifteen years.
Confucius said: 'Filial indeed is Min Zi Qian!

sentences.zh: 人不閒於其父母昆弟之言。」

translations.text: People do not find fault in the words of his parents and brothers.'

sentences.zh: 不仕大夫，不食汙君之祿。

translations.text: Did not serve grand masters, did not eat the salary of corrupt rulers.
'If there are those who call me back, it must be above the Wen.'

Confucius said: 'Filial indeed is Min Zi Qian! People do not find fault in the words of his parents and brothers.' Did not serve grand masters, did not eat the salary of corrupt rulers. 'If there are those who call me back, it must be above the Wen.'
Ran Geng styled Bo Niu.
Confucius considered him to have moral conduct.
Ran Geng styled Bo Niu. Confucius considered him to have moral conduct.

sentences.zh: 伯牛有惡疾，孔子往問之，自牖執其手，曰：「命也夫！

translations.text: Bo Niu had a serious illness, Confucius went to visit him, from the window grasped his hand, said: 'Fate it is!

sentences.zh: 斯人也而有斯疾，命也夫！」

translations.text: This person has this illness, fate it is!'
Bo Niu had a serious illness, Confucius went to visit him, from the window grasped his hand, said: 'Fate it is! This person has this illness, fate it is!'
Ran Yong styled Zhong Gong.
Ran Yong styled Zhong Gong.

sentences.zh: 仲弓問政，孔子曰：「出門如見大賓，使民如承大祭。

translations.text: Zhong Gong asked about governance, Confucius said: 'When going out treat as meeting great guests, when employing people treat as conducting great sacrifice.
In the state no resentment, in the home no resentment.'

Zhong Gong asked about governance, Confucius said: 'When going out treat as meeting great guests, when employing people treat as conducting great sacrifice. In the state no resentment, in the home no resentment.'

sentences.zh: 孔子以仲弓為有德行，曰：「雍也可使南面。」

translations.text: Confucius considered Zhong Gong to have moral conduct, said: 'Yong can be made to face south.'
Confucius considered Zhong Gong to have moral conduct, said: 'Yong can be made to face south.'
Zhong Gong's father was a commoner.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「犁牛之子騂且角，雖欲勿用，山川其舍諸？」

translations.text: Confucius said: "The son of a plow ox is reddish and has horns, though one wishes not to use it, will the mountains and rivers abandon it?"
Zhong Gong's father was a commoner. Confucius said: "The son of a plow ox is reddish and has horns, though one wishes not to use it, will the mountains and rivers abandon it?"

sentences.zh: 冉求字子有，少孔子二十九歲。

translations.text: Ran Qiu styled Ziyou, younger than Confucius by twenty-nine years.
Served as steward for the Ji clan.
Ran Qiu styled Ziyou, younger than Confucius by twenty-nine years. Served as steward for the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 季康子問孔子曰：「冉求仁乎？」

translations.text: Ji Kang Zi asked Confucius: "Is Ran Qiu benevolent?"

sentences.zh: 曰：「千室之邑，百乘之家，求也可使治其賦。

translations.text: Said: "For a town of a thousand households, a family with a hundred chariots, Qiu can be made to manage their taxes.
As for benevolence, I do not know."
Asked again: "Is Zi Lu benevolent?"
Confucius replied: "Like Qiu."

Ji Kang Zi asked Confucius: "Is Ran Qiu benevolent?" Said: "For a town of a thousand households, a family with a hundred chariots, Qiu can be made to manage their taxes. As for benevolence, I do not know." Asked again: "Is Zi Lu benevolent?" Confucius replied: "Like Qiu."
Qiu asked: "Having heard, act on it?"
The Master said: "Act."
Zi Lu asked: "Having heard, act on it?"

sentences.zh: 子曰：「有父兄在，如之何其聞斯行之！」

translations.text: The Master said: "With father and elder brothers present, how can one having heard act on it!"

sentences.zh: 子華怪之，「敢問問同而答異？」

translations.text: Zi Hua was puzzled, "Dare ask why questions same but answers different?"
Confucius said: "Qiu retreats, therefore advance him.
You is overbearing, therefore restrain him."

Qiu asked: "Having heard, act on it?" The Master said: "Act." Zi Lu asked: "Having heard, act on it?" The Master said: "With father and elder brothers present, how can one having heard act on it!" Zi Hua was puzzled, "Dare ask why questions same but answers different?" Confucius said: "Qiu retreats, therefore advance him. You is overbearing, therefore restrain him."
Zhong You styled Zi Lu, a Bian man.
Younger than Confucius by nine years.
Zhong You styled Zi Lu, a Bian man. Younger than Confucius by nine years.

sentences.zh: 子路性鄙，好勇力，志伉直，冠雄雞，佩豭豚，陵暴孔子。

translations.text: Zi Lu nature was coarse, fond of bravery and strength, his will upright and unyielding, wore a cap with fighting cock, carried a piglet sword, bullied Confucius.

sentences.zh: 孔子設禮稍誘子路，子路後儒服委質，因門人請為弟子。

translations.text: Confucius established ritual to gradually guide Zi Lu, Zi Lu later wore Confucian robes and presented introductory gifts, became a disciple.

Zi Lu nature was coarse, fond of bravery and strength, his will upright and unyielding, wore a cap with fighting cock, carried a piglet sword, bullied Confucius. Confucius established ritual to gradually guide Zi Lu, Zi Lu later wore Confucian robes and presented introductory gifts, became a disciple.

sentences.zh: 子路問政，孔子曰：「先之，勞之。」

translations.text: Zi Lu asked about governance, Confucius said: "Lead them, labor them."
Requested more.
Said: "Do not tire."
Zi Lu asked about governance, Confucius said: "Lead them, labor them." Requested more. Said: "Do not tire."
Zi Lu asked: "Does the gentleman value bravery?"
Confucius said: "Righteousness is paramount.

sentences.zh: 君子好勇而無義則亂，小人好勇而無義則盜。」

translations.text: If a gentleman loves bravery but lacks righteousness then chaos, if a petty man loves bravery but lacks righteousness then theft."

Zi Lu asked: "Does the gentleman value bravery?" Confucius said: "Righteousness is paramount. If a gentleman loves bravery but lacks righteousness then chaos, if a petty man loves bravery but lacks righteousness then theft."

sentences.zh: 子路有聞，未之能行，唯恐有聞。

translations.text: Zi Lu upon hearing, feared not being able to practice, only feared not hearing.
Zi Lu upon hearing, feared not being able to practice, only feared not hearing.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「片言可以折獄者，其由也與！」

translations.text: Confucius said: "One who can judge cases with a single phrase, it is You!"
"You loves bravery exceeding me, nothing to take as material."
"If You, will not obtain proper death."

sentences.zh: 「衣敝縕袍，與衣狐貉者立，而不恥者，其由也與！」

translations.text: "One who wears ragged silk robe, stands with those wearing fox and badger furs without shame, it is You!"
"You has ascended the hall, has not yet entered the inner chamber."

Confucius said: "One who can judge cases with a single phrase, it is You!" "You loves bravery exceeding me, nothing to take as material." "If You, will not obtain proper death." "One who wears ragged silk robe, stands with those wearing fox and badger furs without shame, it is You!" "You has ascended the hall, has not yet entered the inner chamber."
Ji Kang Zi asked: "Is Zhong You benevolent?"

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「千乘之國可使治其賦，不知其仁。」

translations.text: Confucius said: "For a state of thousand chariots he can be made to manage taxes, do not know his benevolence."
Ji Kang Zi asked: "Is Zhong You benevolent?" Confucius said: "For a state of thousand chariots he can be made to manage taxes, do not know his benevolence."

sentences.zh: 子路喜從游，遇長沮、桀溺、荷蓧丈人。

translations.text: Zi Lu delighted in following on excursions, encountered Chang Ju, Jie Ni, He Tao Elder.
Zi Lu delighted in following on excursions, encountered Chang Ju, Jie Ni, He Tao Elder.

sentences.zh: 子路為季氏宰，季孫問曰：「子路可謂大臣與？」

translations.text: Zi Lu served as steward for Ji clan, Ji Sun asked: "Can Zi Lu be called a great minister?"
Confucius said: "Can be called a complete minister."
Zi Lu served as steward for Ji clan, Ji Sun asked: "Can Zi Lu be called a great minister?" Confucius said: "Can be called a complete minister."
Zi Lu served as magistrate of Pu, took leave from Confucius.

sentences.zh: 孔子曰：「蒲多壯士，又難治。

translations.text: Confucius said: "Pu has many strong men, moreover difficult to govern.

sentences.zh: 然吾語汝：恭以敬，可以執勇；

translations.text: However I tell you: With respect and reverence can control bravery;
With generosity and uprightness can unite the multitude;
With respect and uprightness and calm can serve superiors."

Zi Lu served as magistrate of Pu, took leave from Confucius. Confucius said: "Pu has many strong men, moreover difficult to govern. However I tell you: With respect and reverence can control bravery; With generosity and uprightness can unite the multitude; With respect and uprightness and calm can serve superiors."

sentences.zh: 初，衛靈公有寵姬曰南子。

translations.text: Initially, Duke Ling of Wei had a favored concubine named Nan Zi.

sentences.zh: 靈公太子蕢聵得過南子，懼誅出奔。

translations.text: Duke Ling crown prince Kui Tun offended Nan Zi, feared execution fled.

sentences.zh: 及靈公卒而夫人欲立公子郢。

translations.text: When Duke Ling died the consort wished to establish Prince Ying.

sentences.zh: 郢不肯，曰：「亡人太子之子輒在。」

translations.text: Ying refused, said: "The fugitive crown prince son Zhe is here."

sentences.zh: 於是衛立輒為君，是為出公。

translations.text: Then Wei established Zhe as ruler, this was Duke Chu.

sentences.zh: 出公立十二年，其父蕢聵居外，不得入。

translations.text: Duke Chu established twelve years, his father Kui Tun dwelt outside, could not enter.

sentences.zh: 子路為衛大夫孔悝之邑宰。

translations.text: Zi Lu served as magistrate of Kong Kui yi for Wei.

sentences.zh: 蕢聵乃與孔悝作亂，謀入孔悝家，遂與其徒襲攻出公。

translations.text: Kui Tun then with Kong Kui made rebellion, planned to enter Kong Kui home, then with his followers attacked Duke Chu.

sentences.zh: 出公奔魯，而蕢聵入立，是為莊公。

translations.text: Duke Chu fled to Lu, Kui Tun entered established, this was Duke Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 方孔悝作亂，子路在外，聞之而馳往。

translations.text: When Kong Kui made rebellion, Zi Lu outside, heard it galloped go.

sentences.zh: 遇子羔出衛城門，謂子路曰：「出公去矣，而門已閉，子可還矣，毋空受其禍。」

translations.text: Met Zi Gao leaving Wei city gate, told Zi Lu: "Duke Chu gone, gate already closed, you can return, do not vainly receive calamity."

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「食其食者不避其難。」

translations.text: Zi Lu said: "One who eats his food does not avoid his difficulties."
Zi Gao finally left.

sentences.zh: 有使者入城，城門開，子路隨而入。

translations.text: Had envoy enter city, city gate opened, Zi Lu followed entered.

sentences.zh: 造蕢聵，蕢聵與孔悝登臺。

translations.text: Approached Kui Tun, Kui Tun with Kong Kui ascended tower.
Zi Lu said: "Ruler why use Kong Kui?
Please obtain and kill him."
Kui Tun not listened.

sentences.zh: 於是子路欲燔臺，蕢聵懼，乃下石乞、壺黶攻子路，擊斷子路之纓。

translations.text: Then Zi Lu wished to burn tower, Kui Tun feared, then sent Shi Qi, Hu Xian attack Zi Lu, struck broke Zi Lu hat string.

sentences.zh: 子路曰：「君子死而冠不免。」

translations.text: Zi Lu said: "Gentleman dies cap not removed."
Then tied hat string died.

Initially, Duke Ling of Wei had a favored concubine named Nan Zi. Duke Ling crown prince Kui Tun offended Nan Zi, feared execution fled. When Duke Ling died the consort wished to establish Prince Ying. Ying refused, said: "The fugitive crown prince son Zhe is here." Then Wei established Zhe as ruler, this was Duke Chu. Duke Chu established twelve years, his father Kui Tun dwelt outside, could not enter. Zi Lu served as magistrate of Kong Kui yi for Wei. Kui Tun then with Kong Kui made rebellion, planned to enter Kong Kui home, then with his followers attacked Duke Chu. Duke Chu fled to Lu, Kui Tun entered established, this was Duke Zhuang. When Kong Kui made rebellion, Zi Lu outside, heard it galloped go. Met Zi Gao leaving Wei city gate, told Zi Lu: "Duke Chu gone, gate already closed, you can return, do not vainly receive calamity." Zi Lu said: "One who eats his food does not avoid his difficulties." Zi Gao finally left. Had envoy enter city, city gate opened, Zi Lu followed entered. Approached Kui Tun, Kui Tun with Kong Kui ascended tower. Zi Lu said: "Ruler why use Kong Kui? Please obtain and kill him." Kui Tun not listened. Then Zi Lu wished to burn tower, Kui Tun feared, then sent Shi Qi, Hu Xian attack Zi Lu, struck broke Zi Lu hat string. Zi Lu said: "Gentleman dies cap not removed." Then tied hat string died.

sentences.zh: 孔子聞衛亂，曰：「嗟乎，由死矣！」

translations.text: Confucius heard Wei chaos, said: "Alas, You died!"
Afterward indeed died.

sentences.zh: 故孔子曰：「自吾得由，惡言不聞於耳。」

translations.text: Therefore Confucius said: "Since I obtained You, evil words not heard at ears."
At this time Zi Gong as Lu envoy to Qi.
Confucius heard Wei chaos, said: "Alas, You died!" Afterward indeed died. Therefore Confucius said: "Since I obtained You, evil words not heard at ears." At this time Zi Gong as Lu envoy to Qi.
Zai Yu styled Zi Wo.
Sharp tongue eloquent speech.

sentences.zh: 既受業，問：「三年之喪不已久乎？

translations.text: Having received teachings, asked: "Three years mourning not too long?

sentences.zh: 君子三年不為禮，禮必壞；

translations.text: Gentleman three years not practice ritual, ritual must decay;
Three years not practice music, music must collapse.

sentences.zh: 舊穀既沒，新穀既升，鉆燧改火，期可已矣。」

translations.text: Old grain already exhausted, new grain already ascended, flint fire changed, period can stop."
Master said: "Are you at peace?"
Said: "At peace."
"You at peace then do it.

sentences.zh: 君子居喪，食旨不甘，聞樂不樂，故弗為也。」

translations.text: Gentleman in mourning, delicious food not sweet, hearing music not joyful, therefore not do."

sentences.zh: 宰我出，子曰：「予之不仁也！

translations.text: Zai Wo left, Master said: "Yu not benevolent!

sentences.zh: 子生三年然後免於父母之懷。

translations.text: Child born three years then free from parents embrace.

sentences.zh: 夫三年之喪，天下之通義也。」

translations.text: Three years mourning, world universal righteousness."

Zai Yu styled Zi Wo. Sharp tongue eloquent speech. Having received teachings, asked: "Three years mourning not too long? Gentleman three years not practice ritual, ritual must decay; Three years not practice music, music must collapse. Old grain already exhausted, new grain already ascended, flint fire changed, period can stop." Master said: "Are you at peace?" Said: "At peace." "You at peace then do it. Gentleman in mourning, delicious food not sweet, hearing music not joyful, therefore not do." Zai Wo left, Master said: "Yu not benevolent! Child born three years then free from parents embrace. Three years mourning, world universal righteousness."
Zai Wo daytime slept.

sentences.zh: 子曰：「朽木不可雕也，糞土之墻不可圬也。」

translations.text: Master said: "Rotten wood cannot carve, manure wall cannot plaster."
Zai Wo daytime slept. Master said: "Rotten wood cannot carve, manure wall cannot plaster."

sentences.zh: 宰我問五帝之德，子曰：「予非其人也。」

translations.text: Zai Wo asked Five Emperors virtue, Master said: "I not that person."
Zai Wo asked Five Emperors virtue, Master said: "I not that person."

sentences.zh: 宰我為臨菑大夫，與田常作亂，以夷其族，孔子恥之。

translations.text: Zai Wo became Lin Zi grand master, with Tian Chang made rebellion, exterminated his clan, Confucius ashamed.
Zai Wo became Lin Zi grand master, with Tian Chang made rebellion, exterminated his clan, Confucius ashamed.
Duanmu Ci, Wei man, styled Zi Gong.
Younger than Confucius by thirty-one years.
Duanmu Ci, Wei man, styled Zi Gong. Younger than Confucius by thirty-one years.

sentences.zh: 子貢利口巧辭，孔子常黜其辯。

translations.text: Zi Gong sharp tongue clever speech, Confucius often suppressed his eloquence.
Asked: "You and Hui which better?"
Replied: "Ci how dare hope Hui!

sentences.zh: 回也聞一以知十，賜也聞一以知二。」

translations.text: Hui hears one knows ten, Ci hears one knows two."
Zi Gong sharp tongue clever speech, Confucius often suppressed his eloquence. Asked: "You and Hui which better?" Replied: "Ci how dare hope Hui! Hui hears one knows ten, Ci hears one knows two."

sentences.zh: 子貢既已受業，問曰：「賜何人也？」

translations.text: Zi Gong having received teachings, asked: "Ci what person?"
Confucius said: "You vessel."
Said: "What vessel?"
Said: "Hu lian."
Zi Gong having received teachings, asked: "Ci what person?" Confucius said: "You vessel." Said: "What vessel?" Said: "Hu lian."

sentences.zh: 陳子禽問子貢曰：「仲尼焉學？」

translations.text: Chen Zi Qin asked Zi Gong: "Zhong Ni where learn?"

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「文武之道未墜於地，在人，賢者識其大者，不賢者識其小者，莫不有文武之道。

translations.text: Zi Gong said: "Wen Wu way not fallen to earth, in people, worthy identify large, unworthy identify small, none not have Wen Wu way.

sentences.zh: 夫子焉不學，而亦何常師之有！」

translations.text: Master where not learn, moreover what constant teacher have!"

sentences.zh: 又問曰：「孔子適是國必聞其政。

translations.text: Again asked: "Confucius go this state must hear its governance.
Seek it?
Or given it?"

sentences.zh: 子貢曰：「夫子溫、良、恭、儉、讓以得之。

translations.text: Zi Gong said: "Master warm, good, respectful, frugal, yielding with get it.

sentences.zh: 夫子之求之也，其諸異乎人之求之也。」

translations.text: Master seek it, perhaps different from people seek it."

Chen Zi Qin asked Zi Gong: "Zhong Ni where learn?" Zi Gong said: "Wen Wu way not fallen to earth, in people, worthy identify large, unworthy identify small, none not have Wen Wu way. Master where not learn, moreover what constant teacher have!" Again asked: "Confucius go this state must hear its governance. Seek it? Or given it?" Zi Gong said: "Master warm, good, respectful, frugal, yielding with get it. Master seek it, perhaps different from people seek it."

sentences.zh: 子貢問曰：「富而無驕，貧而無諂，何如？」

translations.text: Zi Gong asked: "Rich without arrogance, poor without flattery, how?"
Confucius said: "Can;

sentences.zh: 不如貧而樂道，富而好禮。」

translations.text: Not as poor yet joyful in Way, rich yet fond of ritual."
Zi Gong asked: "Rich without arrogance, poor without flattery, how?" Confucius said: "Can; Not as poor yet joyful in Way, rich yet fond of ritual."

sentences.zh: 田常欲作亂於齊，憚高、國、鮑、晏，故移其兵欲以伐魯。

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：學者多稱七十子之徒，譽者或過其實，毀者或損其真，鈞之未睹厥容貌，則論言弟子籍，出孔氏古文近是。

translations.text: Grand Historian said: Scholars many praise seventy disciples followers, praisers sometimes exceed reality, detractors sometimes diminish truth, balanced not seen their appearance, then discuss disciples register, from Kong clan ancient texts near correct.

sentences.zh: 余以弟子名姓文字悉取論語弟子問并次為篇，疑者闕焉。

translations.text: I with disciples names surnames characters all take from Analects disciples questions and sequence as chapter, doubtful leave blank.
